author: timesunion.com
title: Rodger's Quick Take
text: The Mets have the starting pitching and lineup to beat the Dodgers starting Friday night in the best-of-five NL Division Series. The Mets aren't just happy to be in the postseason for the first time in nine years and they are good enough to advance. Los Angeles will be a tough out, because the Dodgers have good starting pitching too. But, the Mets' overall lineup is better and David Wright won't let his team lose. Wright is the captain for a reason, and he is the clear-cut leader of the Mets. You can tell just how focused he is, and the rest of his teammates will feed off him. It's been a long journey for Wright to return to the postseason, and he's on a team that can make a serious run at the World Series. NewsChannel 13's Rodger Wyland can be heard weekdays from 9 a.m. to noon on WOFX 980 AM.
